H0.text: Hot spots are formed when two crustal plates collide with one another.

H1.text: Rift valleys are formed when two crustal plates collide with one another.

H2.text: Mountain ranges are formed when two crustal plates collide with one another.

H3.text: Mid-ocean ridges are formed when two crustal plates collide with one another.

A4.text: Orogeny is a mountain-building process that takes place at a convergent plate margin when plate motion compresses the margin.

A5.text: Continental rifting takes place, which thins the crust and creates basins in which sediments accumulate.
